intro: Pycreus segmentatus, commonly known as the segmented pycreus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, segmented leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
